thread.title: Egg the Pug stolen at knifepoint
thread.title_full: Egg the Pug stolen at knifepoint

title: Egg the Pug stolen at knifepoint
text:
Share on Twitter 
POLICE are searching for thieves who stole a pug from its owner at knifepoint in Sydney overnight. 
The thieves threatened the man with a knife, demanded his wallet and backpack and ran from the scene with the man’s pooch. 
The owner was walking the pooch on Australia Avenue Sydney Olympic Park on Thursday evening when he was set up by the trio, about 10.30pm. 
The 29-year-old called police and scoured the area in an attempt to find the dog. 
The 14-month-old ‘Egg’ is black and has big puppy dog eyes. 
He was last seen with a coiled red collar around its neck. 
The trio are described of being of Mediterranean or Middle Eastern in appearance, about 30-years-old. 
One of the men is described as having a large build, bald head and a goatee. The other two men were described as being of slim build. 
They were all wearing dark shorts. 
Police are urging the men to return the dog to the nearest police station. 
Social media has gone into overdrive in an attempt to locate the dog. 
“That’s like stealing a wee baby, pugs are literally like little babies, they’re very loyal to their owner, I couldn’t even leave mine to go into a shop or she would cry. Poor pug will be so upset,” one woman said. 
Photos of the dog have already been shared hundreds of times on social media in an attempt to help return the dog to its owner. 
Police said they will address the media regarding the theft at 10am
